meanings.definition: To run faster or farther than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was outrunning the gazelle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The Olympic sprinter was outrunning all of his competitors on the track.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident in outrunning him.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a powerful engine, outrunning any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered secrets to the trees, outrunning the storm that followed.

meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed in speed or distance.
meanings.sent1: The new sports car was outrunning all other vehicles on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The marathon runner was outrunning his personal best time with each mile.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outrunning the birds to get to the bird feeder first.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were outrunning his ability to articulate them clearly.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed swiftly, outrunning the meandering stream beside it.
